intro: Triclisia jumelliana, commonly known as the Jumellian triclisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
